column6: I'm very interested in general agents, thus I think that DQN is still the biggest recent step in this direction, event though there are many other advancements that have occurred in sub-problems related to the field.
column7: Almost every aspect in RL is very suboptimal: Generalization, transfer learning, sample efficiency, multi-task, model-based, etc.
column8: Goal based RL, self-supervised RL, alternatives to RL to model learning and inferential processes in agents (e.g. free energy principle, empowerment).
